<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/23/potential-eu-rule-would-standardize-chargers-and-force-apple-to-conform?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Proposed EU Rule Has Apple All Charged Up
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/23/potential-eu-rule-would-standardize-chargers-and-force-apple-to-conform?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="USB-C cord wrapping around apple logo like a boa constrictor" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/f03e001c258a11efa997575c3fae24330ea3a832-1500x1000.jpg">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em><em>Francis Scialabba</em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We’re not the only ones singing the praises of the far-superior USB-C cord. The European Commission (EC) <a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/technology-58665809?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">proposed</a> a rule yesterday that would require small tech gadgets like phones, tablets, and headphones to have the same, standardized chargers. This small change would have huge ramifications for device makers.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The proposal aims to cut down on e-waste and all the perfectly good charging cables European citizens throw out every year, which the commission estimates is over 11,000 tons worth. If the law is passed (and there’s a very good chance it will be), electronics manufacturers will have two years to make all new devices USB-C compatible so consumers won’t need to buy a new charger with every new device.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The EU has been trying to cut down the number of cords in its citizens’ junk drawers since 2009, when there were 30+ different chargers to choose from. It’s slimmed down since then to three popular options.</span><span><br></span><span>
</span>
</li></ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Tim Cook says get your grubby hands off my ports</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The company most affected by the ruling by far would be Apple, the tech company that notoriously does not play well with other devices. While some newer iPad versions have USB-C ports, iPhones still use Apple’s Lightning charger. It could cost the company up to $1 billion to change course.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In 2018, 21% of all smartphones sold in the EU had a Lightning port.</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Apple <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2021/9/23/22626723/eu-commission-universal-charger-usb-c-micro-lightning-connector-smartphones?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">released</a> a statement arguing that this rule would stifle innovation and hurt consumers. In the past, Apple has objected to common charger mandates, saying they would create even <em>more</em> waste when everyone dumps their different cords to replace them with the new one.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture:</strong> Apple and the EU have been getting along about as well as dairy and a Gen Z’s stomach. Among its <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/10/epic-games-wins-lawsuit-apple?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">other</a> antitrust battles, Apple has been accused by the EU of violating competition laws. <em>—MM</em></p>
</div>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/23/potential-eu-rule-would-standardize-chargers-and-force-apple-to-conform&utm_source=facebook_share" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AVIATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/23/faa-says-that-new-measures-are-helping-reduce-the-number-of-unruly-passenger-incidents?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Unruly Airplane Passengers Get More Ruly
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/23/faa-says-that-new-measures-are-helping-reduce-the-number-of-unruly-passenger-incidents?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Scene from the movie Airplane " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=350 src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/a36d8cf1948121d3f76818ad2cdfdf9cd99cba72-475x248.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Scene from the movie Airplane " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/a36d8cf1948121d3f76818ad2cdfdf9cd99cba72-475x248.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The FAA released fresh numbers yesterday showing that while the problem of unruly passengers on flights remains <a href="https://www.faa.gov/newsroom/unruly-passenger-rate-drops-remains-too-high?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">historically high</a>, it’s on a gradual descent.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The agency has recorded 4,385 unruly passenger incidents this year—more than 70% of which involve masks. And so far in 2021, it’s handed out <a href="https://www.axios.com/unruly-air-passenger-incidents-fall-remain-high-c9f07abd-f7f6-427b-aa50-248b368c245d.html?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$1.1 million in fines</a>. But FAA Administrator Steve Dickson said the zero-tolerance policy the agency introduced in January is working: Unruly passenger incidents have fallen 50% from early 2021.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>Routine flights have devolved into daycare centers during the pandemic, with passengers increasingly lashing out over safety policies like mask mandates. In some extreme cases, exasperated flight attendants have resorted to <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/passengers-duct-tape-man-seat-after-air-fight-frontier-airlines-n1275862?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">duct taping</a> the most disobedient passengers to their seats.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>What they have done: Airlines including Southwest and American have </span><span><a href="https://bestlifeonline.com/news-airlines-banning-alcohol/?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">banned</a></span><span> alcohol sales on flights until 2022.</span>
</li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Aviation reps <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/transportation/2021/09/23/unruly-passengers-airplanes-flights/?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">testified</a> on Capitol Hill yesterday as lawmakers put more pressure on the industry to make flying less miserable for everyone. —<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
WEALTH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/23/s-household-wealth-rises-to-record-high-in-second-quarter-fed-reports?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
During the Worst Recession Since WWII, Americans Got Rich
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/23/s-household-wealth-rises-to-record-high-in-second-quarter-fed-reports?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="household wealth" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/6a1d69f381bb5dae79a2b84a7800bdd45d01d644-1500x1000.jpg">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The net worth of US households <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/09/23/household-net-worth-rises-above-141-trillion-but-debt-up-sharply-as-well.html?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rose</a> to a record $141.7 trillion in the second quarter, up 19.6% from a year ago, the Fed reported yesterday.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Net worth = your assets (savings, stock holdings, real estate) – your liabilities (loans, credit card debt).</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The unprecedented rise in net worth reflects two defining trends of the US economy in 2021: a surging stock market and a white-hot housing market. Of the $5.85 trillion increase in net worth, stocks accounted for $3.5 trillion, and real estate appreciation was responsible for $1.2 trillion.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Home equity percentage, or the portion of your home that is actually yours as you pay off a mortgage, </span><span><a href="https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/HOEREPHRE?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rose to 67.7%</a></span><span> in April, the highest level since the 2008 financial crisis.</span>
</li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We had a lot of help along the way. The government’s stimulus measures to counter the Covid-induced recession, such as enhanced unemployment benefits, fortified personal balance sheets with the strength of 10 million lentils.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Increasing net worth also came with a big surge in IOUs. Household debt jumped 7.9% in Q2, a more rapid pace than in previous quarters, spurred by skyrocketing home prices and cheap borrowing costs. —<em>SQ</em></p>
</div>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/23/key-performance-indicators-september-24?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/23/key-performance-indicators-september-24?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="An auto assembly line in Germany" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/57d76be0ed1fbbb45485b5988b81f119d4bd7a14-1024x681.jpg">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Sebastian Kahnert/picture alliance via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>The persistent global chip shortage will cost the auto industry <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/09/23/chip-shortage-expected-to-cost-auto-industry-210-billion-in-2021.html?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$210 billion in revenue</a>, according to consulting firm AlixPartners, nearly double its previous estimate. Automakers are estimated to lose 7.7 million units of production this year as factory shutdowns across Southeast Asia have delayed a return to supply chain normalcy.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“The worst time in the world we want to shut down the government is in the middle of a pandemic where we have 140,000 people a day getting infected and 2,000 people a day dying.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Dr. Fauci is one of many prominent figures <a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/dr-fauci-says-the-worst-time-in-the-world-for-a-government-shutdown-is-in-the-middle-of-a-pandemic-11632426214?rss=1&siteid=rss" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pressuring lawmakers</a> to work out a deal to keep funding the government past next Thursday. The White House budget office told federal agencies yesterday to prepare for the first shutdown of the Covid era.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>The scientist and the AI-assisted, remote-control killing machine. (<a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20210921062229/https://www.nytimes.com/2021/09/18/world/middleeast/iran-nuclear-fakhrizadeh-assassination-israel.html?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">New York Times</a>)</p>

<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s nearly the weekend, but don’t turn your brain off quite yet—here’s a fun logic puzzle from <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/science/2021/aug/23/did-you-solve-it-logical-philosophers?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">the Guardian</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Wittgenstein has been murdered. The culprit is one of either Friedrich Nietzsche, Lou Andreas-Salomé, Karl Marx, or Ludwig Feuerbach. They make the following statements. You have been correctly informed that the guilty person always lies, and everyone else tells the truth.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Nietzsche</strong>: Salomé is the culprit.<strong style="color:#000"><br>Salomé</strong>: Marx is innocent.<br><strong style="color:#000">Feuerbach</strong>: Salomé’s statement is true.<br><strong style="color:#000">Marx</strong>: Nietzsche’s statement is false.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Who killed Wittgenstein?<br></p>

<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Nietzsche.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">From the Guardian: "If Nietzsche is telling the truth, then Salomé is the culprit and therefore a liar. Thus Marx is not innocent, meaning he is the culprit. We can’t have two culprits, since this is forbidden in the setting of the question, and so we are led to contradiction. Nietzsche must therefore be lying. If he is lying, then everyone else tells the truth, which they can without contradiction. Thus Nietzsche killed Wittgenstein."</p>

Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/23/potential-eu-rule-would-standardize-chargers-and-force-apple-to-conform?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nProposed EU Rule Has Apple All Charged Up\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/23/potential-eu-rule-would-standardize-chargers-and-force-apple-to-conform?utm_source=morning_brew\" style=\"text-decoration:none;border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"USB-C cord wrapping around apple logo like a boa constrictor\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/f03e001c258a11efa997575c3fae24330ea3a832-1500x1000.jpg\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWe’re not the only ones singing the praises of the far-superior USB-C cord. The European Commission (EC) \u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/technology-58665809?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eproposed\u003c/a\u003e a rule yesterday that would require small tech gadgets like phones, tablets, and headphones to have the same, standardized chargers. This small change would have huge ramifications for device makers.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe proposal aims to cut down on e-waste and all the perfectly good charging cables European citizens throw out every year, which the commission estimates is over 11,000 tons worth. If the law is passed (and there’s a very good chance it will be), electronics manufacturers will have two years to make all new devices USB-C compatible so consumers won’t need to buy a new charger with every new device.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe EU has been trying to cut down the number of cords in its citizens’ junk drawers since 2009, when there were 30+ different chargers to choose from. It’s slimmed down since then to three popular options.\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eTim Cook says get your grubby hands off my ports\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe company most affected by the ruling by far would be Apple, the tech company that notoriously does not play well with other devices. While some newer iPad versions have USB-C ports, iPhones still use Apple’s Lightning charger. It could cost the company up to $1 billion to change course.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn 2018, 21% of all smartphones sold in the EU had a Lightning port.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eApple \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2021/9/23/22626723/eu-commission-universal-charger-usb-c-micro-lightning-connector-smartphones?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereleased\u003c/a\u003e a statement arguing that this rule would stifle innovation and hurt consumers. In the past, Apple has objected to common charger mandates, saying they would create even \u003cem\u003emore\u003c/em\u003e waste when everyone dumps their different cords to replace them with the new one.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture:\u003c/strong\u003e Apple and the EU have been getting along about as well as dairy and a Gen Z’s stomach. Among its \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/10/epic-games-wins-lawsuit-apple?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eother\u003c/a\u003e antitrust battles, Apple has been accused by the EU of violating competition laws. style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe FAA released fresh numbers yesterday showing that while the problem of unruly passengers on flights remains \u003ca href=\"https://www.faa.gov/newsroom/unruly-passenger-rate-drops-remains-too-high?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid agency has recorded 4,385 unruly passenger incidents this year—more than 70% of which involve masks. And so far in 2021, it’s handed out \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/unruly-air-passenger-incidents-fall-remain-high-c9f07abd-f7f6-427b-aa50-248b368c245d.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$1.1 million in fines\u003c/a\u003e. But FAA Administrator Steve Dickson said the zero-tolerance policy the agency introduced in January is working: Unruly passenger incidents have fallen 50% from early 2021.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eRoutine flights have devolved into daycare centers during the pandemic, with passengers increasingly lashing out over safety policies like mask mandates. In some extreme cases, exasperated flight attendants have resorted to \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/passengers-duct-tape-man-seat-after-air-fight-frontier-airlines-n1275862?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003educt taping\u003c/a\u003e the most disobedient passengers to their seats.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eWhat they have done: Airlines including Southwest and American have \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://bestlifeonline.com/news-airlines-banning-alcohol/?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebanned\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e alcohol sales on flights until 2022.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eAviation reps \u003ca Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe net worth of US households \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/09/23/household-net-worth-rises-above-141-trillion-but-debt-up-sharply-as-well.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erose\u003c/a\u003e to a record $141.7 trillion in the second quarter, up 19.6% from a year ago, the Fed reported yesterday.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNet worth = your assets (savings, stock holdings, real estate) – your liabilities (loans, credit card debt).\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe unprecedented rise in net worth reflects two defining trends of the US economy in 2021: a surging stock market and a white-hot housing market. Of the $5.85 trillion increase in net worth, stocks accounted for $3.5 trillion, and real estate appreciation was responsible for $1.2 trillion.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eHome equity percentage, or the portion of your home that is actually yours as you pay off a mortgage, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/HOEREPHRE?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erose to 67.7%\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in April, the highest level since the 2008 financial crisis.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWe had a lot of help along the way. The government’s stimulus measures to counter the Covid-induced recession, such as enhanced unemployment benefits, fortified personal balance sheets with the strength of 10 million lentils.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eIncreasing net worth also came with a big surge in IOUs. Household debt jumped 7.9% in Q2, a more rapid pace than in previous quarters, spurred by skyrocketing home prices and cheap borrowing costs.
